DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Doxorubicin hydrochloride is a type of antibiotic called an anthracycline that is used as a chemotherapy drug. It blocks an enzyme called topoisomerase II. This stops or slows the growth of cancer cells and other rapidly growing cells by damaging their DNA.Â

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Doxorubicin hydrochloride is approved to be used alone or with other drugs to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: breast cancer. It is used: with other drugs after surgery to remove the primary tumor in women whose cancer has spread to the lymph nodes under the armin patients with metastatic breast cancer
non-small cell lung cancer that is metastatic
small cell lung cancer that is metastatic
soft tissue and bone sarcomas that are metastatic
transitional cell bladder cancer that is metastatic

Section.Para: Doxorubicin hydrochloride is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Doxorubicin hydrochloride is also available in a different form called doxorubicin hydrochloride liposome. For more information, see the Drug Information Summary for Doxorubicin Hydrochloride Liposome.
